DataElement.preferredName: First Abnormal Bone Marrow Prior Myelodysplastic Syndrome Finding Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date related to first abnormal bone marrow cells finding that lead to prior abormal bone marrow cells that can lead to  myelogenous leukemia.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: First Abnormal Bone Marrow Prior Myelodysplastic Syndrome Finding
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to first abnormal bone marrow cells finding that lead to prior abormal bone marrow cells that can lead to  myelogenous leukemia.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:Deviating from the norm.:The soft, sponge-like tissue in the center of bones that produces white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.
The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) is a clonal hematopoietic disorder characterized by dysplasia and ineffective hematopoiesis in one or more of the hematopoietic cell lines.  The dysplasia may be accompanied by an increase in myeloblasts, but the number is less than 20%, which, according to the WHO guidelines, is the requisite threshold for the diagnosis of acute myeloid leukemia.  MDS may occur de novo or as a result of exposure to alkylating agents and/or radiotherapy.  (WHO, 2001) -- 2003:The result of an examination or inquiry.

Concepts.definition: A clonal hematopoietic disorder characterized by dysplasia and ineffective hematopoiesis in one or more of the hematopoietic cell lines. The dysplasia may be accompanied by an increase in myeloblasts, but the number is less than 20%, which, according to the WHO guidelines, is the requisite threshold for the diagnosis of acute myeloid leukemia. It may occur de novo or as a result of exposure to alkylating agents and/or radiotherapy. (WHO, 2001)
The result of an examination or inquiry.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
